metadata.title: CVE-2020-36326 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
PHPMailer 6.1.8 through 6.4.0 allows object injection through PharDeserialization via addAttachment with a UNC pathname. NOTE: this issimilar to CVE-2018-19296, but arose because 6.1.8 fixed a functionalityproblem in which UNC pathnames were always considered unreadable byPHPMailer, even in safe contexts. As an unintended side effect, this fixeliminated the code that blocked addAttachment exploitation.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-36326` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libphp-phpmailer - 6.2.0-2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libphp-phpmailer package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '6.2.0-2').
